<<<api>>>: Activity.findViewById
<<<code>>>: View view = activity.findViewById(R.id.your_view_id);
<<<explanation>>>: This method can be called from the main application thread. It is used to find a view in your activity by its id.

In your case, you are trying to click on a list item in your activity, which is not allowed on the main application thread. You need to run this code in a separate thread or use AsyncTask.

Here is an example of how you can do this:

```java
new Thread(new Runnable() {
    @Override
    public void run() {
        solo.clickInList(0, 1);
    }
}).start();
```

This will start a new thread and run the `solo.clickInList(0, 1);` method in it, allowing you to click on the list item without getting a RuntimeException.

Please replace `0, 1` with the correct index of the list item you want to click on.
